UseCases

Class UserService

  • java.lang.Object
    • UseCases.UserService

  • public class UserService
extends java.lang.Object
    UserService is used to login and logout a User. It also serves as a type of User database/storage. It adds a user and removes a user.
    Version:
    November 17th, 2016
    Author:
    Ulises Martinez, Jorge Huerta, Christopher Tighe, Team Siki
    See Also:
    User

    • Method Detail

      • login

        public User login(java.lang.String username,
                  java.lang.String password)
        Logs a user in the system. Checks if their username and passwords are from the user and returns the User or returns null if the User failed to login.
        Parameters:
        username - The username of the User.
        password - User's password.
        Returns:
        Null if the User could not provide correct credentials to log in.
        See Also:
        User

      • logout

        public void logout(User u)
        It logs the user out. Utilizes method from User class.
        Parameters:
        u - The user.
        See Also:
        User.logout()

      • add

        public void add(User user)
        Adds a User to the Set of users.
        Parameters:
        user - The user being added.

      • remove

        public void remove(User user)
        Removes a User from the Set of users.
        Parameters:
        user - The User being removed from the Set.
